item.title: Zohran Mamdani’s grand promises are a struggle bus
item.description: New York’s working people who depend on transit have the most to lose if the socialist gets his way.

item.title: The U.S.-China trade war is back on
item.description: Like a couple headed for divorce but still cohabitating, what could go wrong?

item.title: Safe investments
item.description: Gold prices are up. What’s next?

item.title: Yet another vindictive prosecution
item.description: Letitia James abused her power while targeting Trump. That doesn’t justify him doing the same.

item.title: Good cop, bad cop in Venezuela
item.description: Secrecy and saber-rattling obscure whether regime change is the true aim of the Trump administration.

item.title: If you’re a man without a mustache, what are you even doing?
item.description: Kissing whiskers and a close shave with the Insurrection Act.

item.title: The infamous ICE raids in Chicago shouldn’t be forgotten
item.description: ICE raids in Chicago and a fire in South Carolina might have something in common.

item.title: The Nobel honors a hero — and Venezuela’s struggle for freedom
item.description: By celebrating María Corina Machado, the committee spotlights a barbaric regime and a stolen election.

item.title: The reading wars are ending. Phonics won.
item.description: California belatedly follows Southern states in abandoning a failed teaching method.

item.title: Cartoon by Lisa Benson
item.description: Lisa Benson cartoon on redistricting in California.

item.title: At last, the world is noticing the persecution of Christians
item.description: Violence against Christians merits U.S. pressure on Nigeria’s government for strong countermeasures.

item.title: She wanted to open a hair salon. Then came Trumpish protectionism.
item.description: To see how bureaucratic economic planning works on the local level, check out Clayton County, Georgia.

item.title: Economists were wrong about tariffs. They need to figure out why.
item.description: They’re becoming as useless as political pollsters.

item.title: There’s only one way China could surpass America
item.description: The nation’s superpower aspirations require adopting U.S. culture and capitalism.

item.title: To my father, I am ever grateful
item.description: Autumn invokes memories of a father-daughter bond that grew after my mother’s death.
